page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: {FARMING(cont)}occasionally keep a cow for domestic milk.A mixture of breeds is kept:Ayrshire, Galloway,Hereford and cross-breeds.Continental Breeds have also been introduced,e.g. Charolais and Limousin.As most of the farmland in the block is part of bigger estates it is hard to be precise about numbers,but at the time of our survey Hartshaugh for example had 340 of various kinds of cattle plus two bulls,and nearly 1000 sheep in our area.Much hearding and shepherding is done with the help of skilful trained{BORDER COLLIE DOGS. {HENS}are commonly kept for eggs but not on a commercial scale-similarly some {GOATS}are kept for milk.{HORSES} are kept for transport on some hill pastures,but mainly for fox-hunting and pleasure.
